title: Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area: Fish
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Fish                Fish                   Rainbow Trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss)               Yellow Bullhead (Ameiurus natalis)         Â    The Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area is home to over 40 species of fish. The river is the southern most trout river in the United States. Buford Dam, at Lake Lanier, releases cold water from the bottom of the lake making the habitat conducive for trout. The Georgia Department of Natural Resources stocks the river with brown, rainbow and brook trout. For a list of fish species found in the park visit the NPSpecies page. Make sure you select Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area (CHAT) and Fish in the drop down menus before clicking on the Search button. Once the list appears click on the Report/PDF button to print out a Species Checklist for the park.
